verses.verse: "I know<WH3045> that you can do<WH3201> all things,<WH4209> and that no purpose of yours can be restrained.<WH1219>

You asked,<WH5956> 'Who is this who hides counsel<WH6098> without knowledge?<WH1847>' therefore I have uttered<WH5046> that which I did not understand,<WH995> things too wonderful<WH6381> for me,<WH3045> which I didn't know.
You said,<WH8085> 'Listen, now,<WH1696> and I will speak; I will question<WH7592> you,<WH3045> and you will answer me.'
I had heard<WH8085> of you by the hearing<WH8088> of the ear,<WH241> but now my eye<WH5869> sees you.<WH7200>
Therefore I abhor<WH3988> myself,<WH5162> and repent in dust<WH6083> and ashes.<WH665>"

It was so,<WH310> that after Yahweh<WH3068> had spoken<WH1696> these words<WH1697> to Job,<WH347> Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite,<WH8489> "My wrath<WH639> is kindled<WH2734> against you,<WH8147> and against your two friends;<WH7453> for you have not spoken<WH1696> of me the thing that is right,<WH3559> as my servant<WH5650> Job has.<WH347>

Now therefore,<WH3947> take to yourselves seven<WH7651> bulls<WH6499> and seven<WH7651> rams,<WH352> and go<WH3212> to my servant<WH5650> Job,<WH347> and offer up<WH5927> for yourselves a burnt offering;<WH5930> and my servant<WH5650> Job<WH347> shall pray<WH6419> for you,<WH5375> for I will accept him,<WH6440> that I not deal<WH6213> with you according to your folly.<WH5039> For you have not spoken<WH1696> of me the thing that is right,<WH3559> as my servant<WH5650> Job has.<WH347>"

So Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489> and Bildad<WH1085> the Shuhite<WH7747> and Zophar<WH6691> the Naamathite<WH5284> went,<WH3212> and did<WH6213> what Yahweh<WH3068> commanded<WH1696> them,<WH3068> and Yahweh accepted<WH5375> Job.<WH6440>
Yahweh<WH3068> turned<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of Job,<WH347> when he prayed<WH6419> for his friends.<WH7453> Yahweh<WH3068> gave<WH3254> Job<WH347> twice as much as he had before.<WH4932>

Then came<WH935> there to him all his brothers,<WH251> and all his sisters,<WH269> and all those who had been of his acquaintance<WH3045> before,<WH6440> and ate<WH398> bread<WH3899> with him in his house.<WH1004> They comforted<WH5162> him,<WH5162> and consoled him concerning all the evil<WH7451> that Yahweh<WH3068> had brought<WH935> on him.<WH376> Everyone also gave<WH5414> him a<WH259> piece of money,<WH7192> and everyone<WH376> a<WH259> ring of gold.<WH2091>

So Yahweh<WH3068> blessed<WH1288> the latter end<WH319> of Job<WH347> more than his beginning.<WH7225> He had fourteen<WH702> thousand<WH505> sheep,<WH6629> six<WH8337> thousand<WH505> camels,<WH1581> one thousand<WH505> yoke<WH6776> of oxen,<WH1241> and a thousand<WH505> female donkeys.<WH860>
He had also seven<WH7658> sons<WH1121> and three<WH7969> daughters.<WH1323>
He called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the first,<WH259> Jemimah;<WH3224> and the name<WH8034> of the second,<WH8145> Keziah;<WH7103> and the name<WH8034> of the third,<WH7992> Keren Happuch.<WH7163>

In all the land<WH776> were no women<WH802> found<WH4672> so beautiful<WH3303> as the daughters<WH1323> of Job.<WH347> Their father<WH1> gave<WH5414> them an inheritance<WH5159> among<WH8432> their brothers.<WH251>
After<WH310> this Job<WH347> lived<WH2421> one hundred<WH3967> forty<WH705> years,<WH8141> and saw<WH7200> his sons,<WH1121> and his sons<WH1121>' sons,<WH1121> to four<WH702> generations.<WH1755>
So Job<WH347> died,<WH4191> being old<WH2205> and full<WH7649> of days.<WH3117>
